content: The following lists events that happened during **(/wiki/1956) in [Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore)**. ## Incumbents - [Governor](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore): Sir [Robert Brown Black](/wiki/Robert_Brown_Black) - [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore): - [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) (until June 7) - [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) (from June 8) - [Chief Secretary](/wiki/List_of_Chief_Secretaries_of_Singapore): Sir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) ## Events ### March - 15 March — [Nanyang University](/wiki/Nanyang_University) is officiated with a flag-raising ceremony, with classes beginning on 30 March. ### April - 23 April — The first Merdeka talks were held, which failed on 23 May after failing to compromise on internal security arrangements. As a result, [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) resigned. ### June - 8 June — [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) became the second [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore) of Singapore. ### August - 17 August — The [Nicoll Highway](/wiki/Nicoll_Highway) and [Merdeka Bridge](/wiki/Merdeka_Bridge,_Singapore) are officially opened. ### October - 10 October — Protests by students occurred after several organisations were dissolved over communist links. The protests continued over two weeks, culminating into [riots](/wiki/Chinese_middle_schools_riots) that occurred on 25 October. ## Births - 12 January — [Matthias Yao](/wiki/Matthias_Yao), former MP for [Marine Parade GRC](/wiki/Marine_Parade_GRC) (MacPherson) - 15 April — [Ho Geok Choo](/wiki/Ho_Geok_Choo), former MP for [West Coast GRC](/wiki/West_Coast_GRC) (Boon Lay) - 23 July — [Iskandar Ismail](/wiki/Iskandar_Ismail), musician and winner of 2008 [Cultural Medallion](/wiki/Cultural_Medallion) in Music (d. (/wiki/2014_in_Singapore)). - 3 September — [Tan Yong Kwang](/wiki/Tay_Yong_Kwang), judge of the Supreme Court. - 5 September — [Low Thia Khiang](/wiki/Low_Thia_Khiang), 8th [Secretary-General of the Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) and 8th [Leader of the Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore)) - 12 September — [Walter Woon](/wiki/Walter_Woon), 5th [Attorney-General of Singapore](/wiki/Attorney-General_of_Singapore) - 1 October — [Chan Soo Sen](/wiki/Chan_Soo_Sen), Former MP for [Joo Chiat SMC](/wiki/Joo_Chiat_Single_Member_Constituency) ## Deaths - 21 July — [Lim Chong Pang](/wiki/Lim_Chong_Pang), prominent businessman and long-time member of the Singapore Rural Board (b. 1904). - 25 July — Ronald John Farrer, Former President of the [Singapore Municipal Commission](/wiki/Municipal_Commission_of_Singapore) (b. 1872). - 13 September — Chia Hock Chwee, fisherman and father-in-law of Lim Chong Pang (b. 1895). - 24 October — [Henry Nicholas Ridley](/wiki/Henry_Nicholas_Ridley), 1st Director of [Singapore Botanic Gardens](/wiki/Singapore_Botanic_Gardens) (b. 1855). - 29 November — Father Stephen Lee, Parish Priest of [Church of St. Teresa](/wiki/Church_of_St_Teresa,_Singapore) (b. 1896). - [List of years in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_years_in_Singapore) This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1956 in Singapore
